text: Between the main kitchen and the auxiliary one,
I have a huge cabinet here.
Do you know what it is for?
Hi everyone!
Welcome to my new studio kitchen!!
As you may know,
I've been working as a food video creator
for 10 years now.
During these 10 years,

my audience and I have experienced 
four kitchens,
two in Germany and two in Vietnam.
These kitchens were the ones that I used every day, too.
Till now, when the number of family members increased to four,
and the video production isn't just on my own anymore,
but of a whole team
So, the daily family kitchen can’t affort.
Besides, the props, dishes, pots and pans etc.,
that I use for filming are increasing day by day,
it's time to have a separate space.
A professional and modern working space
that is the most comfortable for myself and my team
to freely create new recipe videos
with better eye-catching images and high-quality food videos.
And finally, after two months with the help of my husband,
this new studio has been completed.
And today let's join me for a kitchen tour
to see how this studio kitchen is different from other ordinary ones.
This kitchen is located on a separated floor of my house,
where I test new recipes everyday
and create new content with my team,
saving the family kitchen for my husband and kids
so that they have a place to enjoy breakfast and lunch.
Remember my very first kitchen in Germany when I started making videos,
it’s a shared kitchen in a student apartment.
At that time, when watching other Youtube channels
about Korean and Japanese cuisine,
I wished I could do a similar content to promote Vietnamese cuisine.
However, if I had waited until I owned such a separated,
professional and grand studio to start implementing,
I probably wouldn't be where I am today.
After much delay and hesitation
over the inconveniences of the shared kitchen,
I determined to do it.
And that was the beginning of my journey as a food blogger.
After graduation, I rented an apartment in Germany
and re-designed the kitchen on my own
with IKEA's stuffs
based on my limited budget at that time.
Coming back Vietnam,
after a long-time taking advantage of the kitchen in my rented apartment,
I started to set up my own kitchen.
But only until today had I own a dream kitchen
for my own business.
So, let's come with me to explore
what this studio has to offer.
This kitchen is divided into 3 zones,
the main kitchen area is also the studio,
the auxiliary kitchen, and the props area.
I am currently standing in the main kitchen area,
it has a large window providing natural light,
and this is on the 4th floor of the house
overlooking the greens, very nice.
When I first moved in, the sea can be seen from here,
but now many buildings have come up, blocking the view.
Let’s start with the fridge.
This BOSCH fridge has a spacious room
to store all the ingredients for a video shooting.
I don't put too much stuff in here,
only the ingredients for today’s set.
And the below compartment is a freezer.
Having this fridge, I don’t have to worry that
someone will accidentally eat the stuffs I prepared for filming
Next to the fridge is a sink.
White color makes it look clean and clear when on videos.
It is made of marble.
This faucet has 2 spray modes: Pinpoint and shower.
It can be pulled out
so I can scrub and wash, very convenient
The main material of the kitchen is marble and wood
with a color combination of white, beige, and mint green
give it a modern, and dynamic look.
I decorate here with a few cookbooks,
Vietnamese cuisine books,
some flours, a brown rice tea bottle
as well as some greens to make the kitchen look fresher and more alive.
These hanger bars are for hanging some cute kitchen stuffs that I collected.
They can be used for filming and decoration too.
This is a majestic set of spices,
oil, fish sauce, salt, vinegar, soy sauce.
Small jars for salt and seasoning powders,
while the lower ones are for onions, garlic, turmeric, and ginger.
It's impressive and also very convenient.
This bottle can be poured down when I open it,
just like the master chefs on TV.
Here is an extra jar to store other tools.
In the heart of the kitchen,
I have the main kitchen appliances
such as an oven, an induction hob and a kitchen hood.
All are from Bosch - the world's leading home appliance company.
This hob’s surface is made of high-quality glass-ceramic,
so it is very clean, shiny, and easy to clean.
The hob has a 28 cm cooking zone for a large pot
and these two small zones which can be combined when we use a large tray.
The control panel is also very flexible
and I can choose the corresponding heat level.
What I like most is the safety lock mode
that I can set a time for the stove.
So, when I stew meat, for example, I can set it for 30 minutes
and leave it for other things without any fear of burning.
This is perfect for forgetful ones.
Here is the cooker hood.
It’s so special, we can pull it out.
The hood has lighting and the odor extractor volume is adjustable.
In addition, this hood has an aluminum grease filter
that can be disassembled and washed in dishwashers.
Next, here I have a KitchenAid mixer
– a dream mixer that any baking lover must have in their kitchen.
This mixer is very special
because I had to ask a family relative to bring it from the US
and the machine has a glass bowl
so she had to be very careful on the way.
When on video,
the audience could see the dough
and ingredients inside for easier following.
Here is a decor-shelf area.
I ordered it in beige wood to give it a modern look
look so I can display my favorite items that I have collected from my trips.
This is a Marshall speaker
for entertaining my team, giving some good mood when working.
This is a silver bowl
that I collected from Laos.
And here are some wooden souvenirs from Thailand.
This is my favorite set of mortars from Zwilling.
More Cookbooks here.
This is Minh Long healthy cook pot for stews and braises.
The drawers below contain blenders.
I have 2 blenders:
one is a Bosch hand blender
and the other is from Grundig
– a German brand that I really love and have hand-carried it home.
Next, let's explore with me what's in this cabinet.
Tadaaaa, my mini stoves!
Although I already have a super big induction cooktop here,
I also needs a mini stove for some detailed shots, easier for viewers to follow.
First is a single induction cooktop in beige color that matches my Fika one.
A lot of people like this cooktop and keep asking me where to buy it.
You can buy it from shopee or lazada.
Here I have pots and pans,
and compartments for lids.
This arrangement is very convenient and easy to take it out.
Here are 3 more mini gas stoves, multi-color.
Depending on the video theme, I will use the matching one.
Here is the red mini stove,
and here is the very cute Korean yellow stove from Dr. HOWS.
This is my old gas stove,
but I asked my husband to repaint it in mint to match the color of the kitchen.
It's pretty old but with its new appearance it’s cute, isn't it?
These pull-out drawers are where I store some cake molds and mixing bowls.
On this door there is a place to hang cleaning bottles,
very convenient and clean and tidy.
And the very important and most often shown area
is the kitchen island.
This kitchen island is made of Italian stone in pure white.
I leave it empty here.
Do you know why?
Because it is a movable kitchen island.
When I stand at this point, I have a kitchen here,
and when I turn it to this side, I have another set.
You see, when I turn it around like this,
I have a look-like-new kitchen space to show in the video, more filming backgrounds.
This kitchen island also has extra drawers for storage.
or example, towels, lots of towels,
and placemats
so my food stylist can mix and match colors and materials based on the video theme.
Here is a range of small glass bowls of spices.
The reason I choose glass is that
the viewers can see what’s the ingredients inside the video.
A variety of bowls and cups to display,
the food stylist will stand here to play with it when onset.
For the projects with hand-talent only,
my team will do close-up shots of this island kitchen area.
That is the reason why I did not set up an induction cooktop or anything on this table
so that I could have room to display the foods and film different scenes here.
In this drawer,
I store food wrap and gloves,
baking paper and foil paper.
And here are all kinds of measuring cups,
tools and spoons.
My special stuffs are in here.
This is a bag of metal fork and spoon,
these items are fragile, so I have to carefully wrap them in plastic like this
to avoid scratches so that they always look like new for filming.
So, this one is the bag of metals,
and here is another bag
containing wooden items such as spoons, straws, honey pickers.
All kinds of spoons in the world
that I have collected, I keep it in this bag.
When filming some shoots of me standing cooking like this,
I use gas stove, single induction cooker
for more convenient
and when I don't need it, I just clear it to aside so I can shoot other scenes.
Now, you guys are seeing me standing at a corner that is opposite the kitchen.
Here I have another shelf.
If I want another scene,
I can pull the kitchen island over and have another kitchen background, a new angle.
There are a lot of cutting boards here,
I love collecting cutting boards and wooden trays
for filming props and kitchen decoration at the same time.
Here are two JYSK rattan chairs
so that my team members can rest here if anyone feels tired.
I like this chair because it has an extra space underneath
to put chargers or random items to make the room more organized.
In the corner, there is a very comfortable rocking chair so that,
when I’m too tired from standing cooking, I can sit here to rest.
Or having a me-time with a morning coffee and enjoy the view outside.
A special thing of this studio
is the majestic ceiling light system
with a detailed installation system.
Although this room has a big window providing a good source of natural light,
I still equipped the room with a huge lighting system in case I have to shoot at night.
This lighting system is installed on a rail system fixed in the ceiling.
It is very interesting, check it out.
These lights can be adjusted the height
as well as dragged back and forth
to spot the light to the space I want.
And here is a secret door,
you guys must be very curious what is in here,
let's go in and have a look!
Tadaaa, this is my makeup room
to dress up for shooting.
It has a very nice lamp here,
I can wash my hands, wear contact lenses,
fix makeup and hair.
Behind this door are my collection of aprons,
depending on the video, I will choose a suitable one.
Over here is the area for backdrops
where the food stylist can find a matching background
for the video that day.
This room is also a storage for the equipment and extra lights.
Separate the main kitchen and the auxiliary kitchen,
I have a giant cabinet here.
Do you know what to do?
Tadaaa, this is a cupboard.
Moving the kitchen up here, I have enough room to put a spacious cabinet to store things.
As you can see, these stuffs are not a complete set,
but they are all single items.
This compartment is for white dishes
and the above are color and pattern items.
The upper compartment is beautiful small bowls
and plates for decorations.
I'm very diligent in collecting these items.
When I see beautiful things, I collect them all.
After 10 years, it came out a bunch like this.
These are all kinds of bowls,
Japanese bowls, Vietnamese bowls, patterns and variety of Bat Trang ceramics.
This room I keep fake ice cubes for making drinks.
Here are wooden items, bamboo and rattan
for food arrangement
egg baskets,
dim sum steamer.
These are coasters,
just single one, not many.
If each one comes with a complete set, there is probably no room for all.
Above is cups and teapots,
I also have 5-10 teapots,
I only got 1-2 cups for each one otherwise I need a bigger room for all of them.
This is a mini-set to eat cheese, isn't it cute?
These are all beautiful little things that I have collected.
One more blender from BOSCH.
Above are the miscellaneous items that are still in the box, rarely used.
It's not over yet, there's one more cabinet here.
It has a compartment for glassware,
many kinds of glasses.
Same with other things, I have 1 or 2 pieces of each pieces to use for custom sets.
Above compartments are the place of dry ingredients,
this room is for baking stuffs
like baking powder, food coloring, etc.
This room is for glutinous rice, flour, tea, etc.
Above are spices such as vinegar, honey,
pepper, cinnamon powder, chocolate.
And above are the cake molds and mixer.
Still not finished
it's a super huge cabinet can store the world.
This compartment is divided into many cells
for trays,
mainly bamboo and rattan stuffs,
cutting boards
and all kinds and sizes of wooden items.
Here is the place to put the gas tank, and the gas stove.
Here are all types of silicone mold:
heart molds, fruit shaped molds, etc.,
to make jelly or chocolate.
Here are some little cute signages,
when I do live stream, I will write down the ingredients
so the viewers can easily follow them.
And next to this is a compartment
for miscellaneous kitchen tools
such as stick mixer,
sieves,
tongs,
and rarely used items such as ice cream scoop, citrus juicer, grater and masher.
These molds are kept in plastic bags to prevent dust.
Do you know what this is?
This is used for crushing garlic.
I rarely use it but it's pretty. So, I bought it
Now let's go to the auxiliary kitchen area.
And now we're in the auxiliary kitchen area of my studio.
This is the place where my assistant will support me in preparing ingredients
as well as cleaning up after filming sessions.
As you can see, here is a Xiaomi vacuum and mopping robot
it can talk.
After each shot, it will help Helen clean the studio.
This is a Bosch dishwasher with a semi-integrated design,
a stainless-steel control panel
and a wooden front which features the same color tone as the kitchen
making the kitchen space look more harmonious.
The dishwasher’s capacity is really spacious
that I can wash a lot of items at the same time.
You can't imagine the number of dishes and bowls
that we use for a simple dish when filming.
A plenty of dishes need to be washed.
In particular, this dishwasher also has sanitize feature,
I can optionally increases the time and temperature of the final rinse
to eliminate up to 99.9% of bacteria.
There is also a microwave
so that my assistant can defrost ingredients.
This is a moisture-proof cabinet
for cameras equipment to prevent moldy.
There is also a kettle,
a sink
so she can wash vegetables or dishes.
There's a trolley here, it's a bit messy.
This trolley can be used to prepare simple ingredients.
On the other hand, it is used to transport ingredients to the main kitchen to fill up.
This is a multipurpose table.
I can arrange or process ingredients for filming.
Or during the live stream,
the technical team can sit here to operate the camera equipments.
On the wall are some paintings of my uncle
drawing typical dishes of Vietnamese cuisine that I like very much.
This is the behind-the-scenes of everyone preparing for the live recording.
You also see how careful my team have to prepare in order to get the best videos with quality content.
Thank you for visiting my kitchen today
and hope you have a pleasant visit.
If you are interested in the products that I have metioned in this kitchen,
I will leave the link in the comment section below.
Don't forget to follow Helen's Recipes
so that me and my team will have more motivation
to create more interesting and creative content for everyone.
For now, goodbye and see you in the next videos.
Bye bye.
